content.description: A route where the heel-hook is actually useful.
content.protection: Adequate, but you will be well above gear (and pumped) after pulling the crux;  perhaps not as G as the guidebook implies.  Gear-only anchor.
content.location: Start in block, left facing corner below two left-facing roofs.  Climb up corner, escaping roofs to the left, and face above.  Easy walk-off.

content.description:
Including this for completeness sake. 

  I've never seen anyone attempt this one.  It's a lead-only 5.11b with a 30' traverse under a massive block/roof.
content.protection: Unknown.  As it was Rich Romano who led it, I'd suspect no better than PG.  Gear-only anchor at top.
content.location: Start under the right corner of the large, obvious, upper roof.  Straight up into corner, then traverse obvious horizontal seams left to escape the roof.  Straight up to the top.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Impossible is right - no TRing this monster.  Never seen anyone actually climb it, although the guidebook has a picture of Rich Romano leading it.  Only one other route on this wall, but it gets good reviews.
